greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) (n>=4, k=3..n+1) is the number of topologies t on n points having exactly k open sets such that t contains exactly one open set of size m for each m in {0,3,4,5,...,s,n} where s is the size of the largest proper open set in t.
link: G. A. Kamel, Partial Chain Topologies on Finite Sets, Computational and Applied Mathematics Journal. Vol. 1, No. 4, 2015, pp. 174-179.
mathematica: i = 3; Table[Table[Binomial[n, i] FactorialPower[n - i, k], {k, 0, n - i - 1}], {n, 2, 12}] // Grid (* _Geoffrey Critzer_, Feb 19 2017 *)
xref: Triangles in this series: A268216, A268217, A268221, A268222, A268223.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 30 2016
ext: Title clarified and more terms added by _Geoffrey Critzer_, Feb 19 2017
